cardList.title: What is an orphan card?
cardList.content:
## What is an orphan card?

An orphan card is a card that doesn’t belongs to any whiteboards.

You can import it into a whiteboard, and it’ll no longer be an orphan card.

cardList.title: xxWhat is Card Library?
cardList.content:
# xxWhat is Card Library?

### English

* All cards live in the **==Card Library==**.

  * **==Timeline==** displays all cards in the order of created time.

* You can put a card on multiple whiteboards. [This card appears in 2 whiteboard.](./This%20card%20appears%20in%202%20whiteboard.%20d6fde5a8-1878-4228-8dfc-379da13849b4.md "This card appears in 2 whiteboard.")

  * **==Map==** displays all whiteboards in a infinity space.
  * An orphan card is a card that doesn’t belongs to any whiteboards.

### 中文版

* 所有卡片都在 **==Card Library==** 裡頭。

  * **==Timeline==** 會將所有卡片按照創建時間排序。

* 一張卡片可以放在一個或多個白板裡頭。

  * **==Map==** 會將所有白板放在一起用地圖的方式呈現。[This card appears in 2 whiteboard.](./This%20card%20appears%20in%202%20whiteboard.%20d6fde5a8-1878-4228-8dfc-379da13849b4.md "This card appears in 2 whiteboard.")

  * 不在任何白板的卡片被稱作 Orphan。

cardList.title: This card appears in 2 whiteboard.
cardList.content:
# This card appears in 2 whiteboard.

This card appears in 2 whiteboard. If you are viewing this card in a whiteboard, you can click **“Appear in 2 whiteboard“** button to open the info window, and **switch** **between** different whiteboards that have this card.

這張卡片出現在兩個白板裡頭。如果你現在在白板裡頭，你可以點擊「**Appear in 2 whiteboard**」來查看這張卡片在哪些白板出現過，並快速在不同白板之間切換。

![](https://i.imgur.com/8uquBnL.png)

![](https://i.imgur.com/DGY17Yv.png)

cardList.title: Blitz.js
cardList.content:
# Blitz.js

* Website: [Blitz JS](https://blitzjs.com/)

* Zero-API data layer via [RPC: Magic Imports](./RPC%3A%20Magic%20Imports%20b67972d5-a44d-4ad7-b3a8-9909905c2c21.md "RPC: Magic Imports")

* Framework agnostic toolkit for RPC and full stack functionality like Auth

* Inspired by Rails

* Included:

  * [Prisma](./Prisma%205447c17c-3ef6-4320-98b0-31cc3e3301ea.md "Prisma")

  * Custom Auth

  * [RPC: Magic Imports](./RPC%3A%20Magic%20Imports%20b67972d5-a44d-4ad7-b3a8-9909905c2c21.md "RPC: Magic Imports")

  * [API Routes](./API%20Routes%207b1099da-59c4-4f8f-87db-56bc29bcead4.md "API Routes")

cardList.title: API Routes
cardList.content:
# API Routes

files-based routing for the API side as well, where each file in the `/api` folder becomes an API endpoint with the same path.

### **Pros**

* simple to understand
* separation between frontend and backend
* API can be used by other clients  (just make REST requests)
* Endpoints can be used as webhooks
* code splitting by default

### Cons

* colocation

* type-safety: have to declare the return type in the API as well as where its used on the client

* based on implementation, might have to learn new server-side API for Request, Response and middleware

cardList.title: RPC: Magic Imports
cardList.content:
# RPC: Magic Imports

Server declares its API as a GraphQL schema that is introspectable and allows client to describe their query or mutation finely using a DSL

### Pros

### Cons

* Sever-code is strictly in a different file from where its used

* In Blitz case, in different folders for query/mutation

cardList.title: NextJS
cardList.content:
# NextJS

* Website: [https://nextjs.org/]()

* Repo: <https://github.com/vercel/next.js>

* “Meta-framework”

* Technology choices:

  * [React](./React%207499344d-354c-4850-95e2-71d85d1fcb35.md "React")

  * [Webpack](./Webpack%20db722867-f554-4839-bcb8-69874331c6bb.md "Webpack")

* Design/API choices:

  * [File-based routing](./File-based%20routing%20d0ef095a-66f7-4518-9e1e-7d738e221df0.md "File-based routing")

  * [API Routes](./API%20Routes%207b1099da-59c4-4f8f-87db-56bc29bcead4.md "API Routes")

  * `getServerSideProps` : data for [Server Side Rendering (SSR)](./Server%20Side%20Rendering%20(SSR)%201c99c574-d518-4bd6-9b46-67a6c239941a.md "Server Side Rendering (SSR)")

cardList.title: React
cardList.content:
# React

* [JSX](./JSX%208bff2e97-4422-42fd-a1f3-614e47c4f4e1.md "JSX")

* [VDOM](./VDOM%20e0821d49-9c26-421f-8b57-67e2614d4b9d.md "VDOM")

* [Components](./Components%204361ffbd-4bb8-466d-aadc-a47b8314f68f.md "Components")

  * [Composing UI](./Composing%20UI%20afdae9df-8911-4ffd-a442-d2bdfb361708.md "Composing UI") and encapsulating local logic

  * Isolating renders to parts of the tree

  * Return [VDOM](./VDOM%20e0821d49-9c26-421f-8b57-67e2614d4b9d.md "VDOM") representation

* Requires [Compilation](./Compilation%2053daf966-4c41-4b25-a11c-1a6f6084a827.md "Compilation") for:

  * [JSX](./JSX%208bff2e97-4422-42fd-a1f3-614e47c4f4e1.md "JSX")

* [Custom Renderers](./Custom%20Renderers%2034fb9528-4c30-4770-87b9-5e5591e1ace9.md "Custom Renderers")

  * [react-three-fiber](./react-three-fiber%205a82cf19-e0a8-467b-b2d4-905ee716572e.md "react-three-fiber"): [Three.js](./Three.js%207835b4eb-1ad2-467f-8d31-fbf4d9733e9f.md "Three.js")

  * [ink](./ink%20c2e87970-b372-45cc-84e5-ec6f3df34f10.md "ink"): Node terminal, [Command Line Interfaces (CLI)](./Command%20Line%20Interfaces%20(CLI)%20a6c65ccf-3c48-4253-98ee-7c7ea3bebda3.md "Command Line Interfaces (CLI)")

cardList.title: VDOM
cardList.content:
# VDOM

* Intermediate representation of the UI which is light weight and cheap to produce. 

* Used by UI Frameworks like [React](./React%207499344d-354c-4850-95e2-71d85d1fcb35.md "React"), [Preact](./Preact%202339be81-f35d-49cd-8e03-b5c8fce83bff.md "Preact"), [Vue](./Vue%203c160747-8320-4425-95c3-670fb165aeaf.md "Vue") as the core rendering mechanism.

* Basic logic

  * UI is composed of a tree of JSON objects nested via a `children` field on the objects

  * Framework know how to render this representation to an actual UI implementation, eg. [DOM](./DOM%20f830c2e6-db35-481f-bb31-559e8dc8e3b5.md "DOM"), [Native Apps](./Native%20Apps%20accb8d78-20c3-40e4-a73a-698f17134497.md "Native Apps"), [Command Line Interfaces (CLI)](./Command%20Line%20Interfaces%20(CLI)%20a6c65ccf-3c48-4253-98ee-7c7ea3bebda3.md "Command Line Interfaces (CLI)")

  * On state update or events received,

    * Component functions are rerun to get latest  [VDOM](./VDOM%20e0821d49-9c26-421f-8b57-67e2614d4b9d.md "VDOM") representation. 

      * framework minimize the components they needs to rerun if they knows where the change was localized, eg. setState in a component will only render that component and the tree below it

    * Framework then diffs ([reconciliation)](./Reconciliation)%20d1a7b84a-744c-43cc-9aca-8cfffd345cf3.md "Reconciliation)") the new [VDOM](./VDOM%20e0821d49-9c26-421f-8b57-67e2614d4b9d.md "VDOM") with the previous one, and figures out what it needs to do to get the actual UI implementation to the correct state.

cardList.title: Blitz.js (old)
cardList.content:
# Blitz.js (old)

* Website: [Blitz JS](https://blitzjs.com/)

* Zero-API data layer via [RPC: Magic Imports](./RPC%3A%20Magic%20Imports%20b67972d5-a44d-4ad7-b3a8-9909905c2c21.md "RPC: Magic Imports")

* Full stack framework

* Inspired by Rails

* Included:

  * [NextJS](./NextJS%200aab5436-48df-4d12-9edc-1c97158f402e.md "NextJS")

  * [Webpack](./Webpack%20db722867-f554-4839-bcb8-69874331c6bb.md "Webpack")

  * [React](./React%207499344d-354c-4850-95e2-71d85d1fcb35.md "React")

  * [Prisma](./Prisma%205447c17c-3ef6-4320-98b0-31cc3e3301ea.md "Prisma")

  * [File-based routing](./File-based%20routing%20d0ef095a-66f7-4518-9e1e-7d738e221df0.md "File-based routing")

  * Custom Auth

  * [RPC: Magic Imports](./RPC%3A%20Magic%20Imports%20b67972d5-a44d-4ad7-b3a8-9909905c2c21.md "RPC: Magic Imports")

  * [API Routes](./API%20Routes%207b1099da-59c4-4f8f-87db-56bc29bcead4.md "API Routes")

attach logic to dom elements as props)

cardList.title: React Server Components
cardList.content:
# React Server Components

* React VM to virtualize the browser

* Browser within the browser,

* Behaves like MPA, whole reroute is rerendered on the server

* But its send down the VDOM representation that can be used to update the page instead of blowing up all the inputs/focus, since its just reconciliation (what React does normally)

* Without the VDOM, this is difficult to do

cardList.title: Mutations
cardList.content:
# Mutations

* Actions/events from the UI that lead to updates on the backend
* Often lead to invalidation of existing data that the user sees since it could be updated
* [Solid](./Solid%20714ec1d8-f6b3-468e-a77d-972c471bb635.md "Solid") example: <https://codesandbox.io/s/solid-todos-mutation-v2-llequ?file=/src/index.tsx>
